006
007package renderer.models_T;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.Triangle;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a solid model of a regular tetrahedron
015   with its center at the origin, having edge length
016   {@code 2*sqrt(2)}, and with its vertices at corners
017   of the cube with vertices {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}.
018<p>
019   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetrahedron" target="_top">
020                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetrahedron</a>
021
022   @see Cube
023   @see Octahedron
024   @see Icosahedron
025   @see Dodecahedron
026*/
027public class Tetrahedron extends Model implements MeshMaker
028{
029   public final int n1;
030   public final int n2;
031
032   /**
033      Create a regular tetrahedron with its center at
034      the origin, having edge length {@code 2*sqrt(2)},
035      and with its vertices at corners of the cube with
036      vertices {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}.
037   */
038   public Tetrahedron()
039   {
040      this(false);
041   }
042
043
044   /**
045      Create a regular tetrahedron or its dual tetrahedron
046      (the dual of a tetrahedron is another tetrahedron).
047   <p>
048      <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetrahedron#Regular_tetrahedron" target="_top">
049               https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetrahedron#Regular_tetrahedron</a>
050   <p>
051      The combination of these two dual tetrahedrons is a stellated octahedron.
052   <p>
053      <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stellated_octahedron" target="_top">
054               https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stellated_octahedron</a>
055
056      @param dual  choose between the two dual tetrahedrons
057   */
058   public Tetrahedron(final boolean dual)
059   {
060      super("Tetrahedron");
061
062      this.n1 = 0;
063      this.n2 = 0;
064
065      // Create the tetrahedron's geometry.
066      // It has 4 vertices, 6 edges, and 4 faces.
067      if (! dual)
068      {
069         addVertex(new Vertex( 1,  1,  1),
070                   new Vertex(-1,  1, -1),
071                   new Vertex( 1, -1, -1),
072                   new Vertex(-1, -1,  1));
073      }
074      else // Create the dual tetrahedron by
075      {    // inverting the coordinates given above.
076         addVertex(new Vertex(-1, -1, -1),
077                   new Vertex( 1, -1,  1),
078                   new Vertex(-1,  1,  1),
079                   new Vertex( 1,  1, -1));
080      }
081
082      // Create four triangles.
083      addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 3), // top edge
084                   new Triangle(1, 0, 2),
085                   new Triangle(3, 2, 0), // bottome edge
086                   new Triangle(2, 3, 1));
087   }
088
089
090   /**
091      Create a regular tetrahedron with its center at
092      the origin, having edge length {@code 2*sqrt(2)},
093      and with its vertices at corners of the cube with
094      vertices {@code (±1, ±1, ±1)}.
095      <p>
096      Add line segments fanning out from each vertex to
097      its opposite edge.
098
099      @param n1 number of lines fanning out from v0 and v1 towards the edge (v2, v3)
100      @param n2 number of lines fanning out from v2 and v3 towards the edge (v0, v1)
101      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n1} is less than 0
102      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n2} is less than 0
103   */
104   public Tetrahedron(final int n1, final int n2)
105   {
106      super(String.format("Tetrahedron(%d,%d)", n1, n2));
107
108      if (n1 < 0)
109         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n1 must be greater than or equal to 0");
110      if (n2 < 0)
111         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n2 must be greater than or equal to 0");
112
113      this.n1 = n1;
114      this.n2 = n2;
115
116      // Create the tetrahedron's geometry.
117      // It has 4 vertices and 6 edges.
118      final Vertex v0 = new Vertex( 1,  1,  1),
119                   v1 = new Vertex(-1,  1, -1),
120                   v2 = new Vertex( 1, -1, -1),
121                   v3 = new Vertex(-1, -1,  1);
122
123      addVertex(v0, v1, v2, v3);
124
125      // Create four triangular faces.
126      addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 3),  // top edge
127                   new Triangle(1, 0, 2),
128                   new Triangle(3, 2, 0),  // bottome edge
129                   new Triangle(2, 3, 1));
130
131      fan(n1, 0,  3, 2); // fan out from v0
132      fan(n1, 1,  2, 3); // fan out from v1
133      fan(n2, 2,  1, 0); // fan out from v2
134      fan(n2, 3,  0, 1); // fan out from v3
135   }
136
137
138   /**
139      Create {@code n} line segments fanning out from {@link Vertex}
140      {@code v0} towards the edge spanned by the other two vertices.
141
142      @param n    number of lines fanning out from {@link Vertex} {@code v0}
143      @param v0   index in the {@link Vertex} list of the vertex to fan out from
144      @param v1i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
145      @param v2i  index to a {@link Vertex} opposite to {@code v0}
146   */
147   private void fan(final int n, final int v0, final int v1i,
148                                               final int v2i)
149   {
150      final Vertex v1 = vertexList.get(v1i);
151      final Vertex v2 = vertexList.get(v2i);
152
153      // Create vertices along the edge from v1 to v2.
154      int index = vertexList.size();
155      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
156      {
157         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
158         final double t = (double)(i+1) / (double)(n+1);
159         final double x = (1-t) * v1.x + t * v2.x;
160         final double y = (1-t) * v1.y + t * v2.y;
161         final double z = (1-t) * v1.z + t * v2.z;
162         addVertex(new Vertex(x, y, z));
163      }
164      // Create n triangles.
165      if (n > 0) addPrimitive(new Triangle(v0, v1i, index));
166      for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i)
167      {
168         addPrimitive(new Triangle(v0, index+i, index+i+1));
169      }
170   }
171
172
173
174   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
175   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return this.n1;}
176
177   @Override public int getVertCount() {return this.n2;}
178
179   @Override
180   public Tetrahedron remake(final int n, final int k)
181   {
182      return new Tetrahedron(n, k);
183   }
184}//Tetrahedron
